metadata.title: CVE-2024-27055 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:workqueue: Don't call cpumask_test_cpu() with -1 CPU inwq_update_node_max_active() For wq_update_node_max_active(), @off_cpu of -1indicates that no CPU is going down. The function was incorrectly callingcpumask_test_cpu() with -1 CPU leading to oopses like the following on somearchs: Unable to handle kernel paging request at virtual addressffff0002100296e0 .. pc : wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc lr :wq_update_node_max_active+0x1f0/0x1fc ... Call trace:wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc apply_wqattrs_commit+0xf0/0x114apply_workqueue_attrs_locked+0x58/0xa0 alloc_workqueue+0x5ac/0x774workqueue_init_early+0x460/0x540 start_kernel+0x258/0x684__primary_switched+0xb8/0xc0 Code: 9100a273 35000d01 53067f00 d0016dc1(f8607a60) ---[ end trace 0000000000000000 ]--- Kernel panic - not syncing:Attempted to kill the idle task! ---[ end Kernel panic - not syncing:Attempted to kill the idle task! ]--- Fix it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
